greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fundamental positive solution y = y2(n) of the second class of the Pell equation x^2 - 2*y^2 = -A001132(n), n>=1 (primes congruent to {1,7} mod 8)
comment: For the corresponding term x2(n) see A255247(n).
formula: A255247(n)^2 - 2*a(n)^2 = -A001132(n), n >= 1, gives the second smallest positive (proper) solution of this (generalized) Pell equation.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 19 2015
